articles.author: Tom Balmforth, Yuliia Dysa
articles.description: Ukraine said on Wednesday it was destroying Russian pontoon bridges with U.S.-made weapons to defend its incursion into Russia's Kursk region, as Moscow said its forces had halted Kyiv's advance there and gained ground in eastern Ukraine.
articles.title: Ukraine says it hits pontoon bridges in Russia, Moscow reports gains

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, James Mackenzie
articles.description: Israeli airstrikes across Gaza killed at least 50 Palestinians in the past 24 hours, Palestinian health authorities said on Wednesday, as the military said troops continued to target militants and seize weapons and ammunition.
articles.title: Israeli strikes kill dozens in Gaza after Blinken ends visit with truce deal still elusive

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukraine launched a widespread drone attack on Russia on Wednesday, with air defence units destroying three drones some 38 kms (24 miles) south of the Kremlin, and 15 over the border Bryansk region, Russian officials said.
articles.title: Ukraine launches drone attack on Moscow, other regions, Russian officials say

articles.author: Andrea Shalal
articles.description: Minnesota Governor Tim Walz accepts the Democratic nomination for vice president on Wednesday with 11 weeks to go before he and presidential running mate Kamala Harris face Republican former President Donald Trump in the 2024 U.S. election.
articles.title: DNC on Wednesday: Minnesota's Walz, Pelosi, Bill Clinton

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The helicopter crash in which Iran's late President Ebrahim Raisi was killed in May was caused by weather conditions and the aircraft's inability to handle the weight it was carrying, Iran's semi-official news agency reported on Wednesday, citing a security source informed of the final investigation results.
articles.title: Helicopter of Iran's late President Raisi crashed due to weather, Fars says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israel's outgoing head of military intelligence took responsibility for his country's failures to defend its border on Oct. 7 at his resignation ceremony on Wednesday.
articles.title: Israeli military intelligence head leaves post, takes responsibility for Oct. 7 failure

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Shahed Abu Omar, 20, was in her third year studying computer science at Gaza’s Al Azhar University when it was reduced to rubble by Israel's military campaign in the Palestinian territory.
articles.title: Displaced Gaza student tries to study despite destruction of universities

articles.author: Marianna Parraga
articles.description: The U.S. has drafted a list of about 60 Venezuelan government officials and family members who could be sanctioned in the first punitive measures following the South American country's disputed presidential election in July, two people close to the matter said.
articles.title: Exclusive: US drafts list of 60 Venezuelans for possible sanctions over election, sources say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Three employees of a high school in the western Bosnian town of Sanski Most were killed and one seriously wounded when a man also employed in the school opened fire on Wednesday, local media reported citing the regional police.
articles.title: Three dead, one wounded in shooting in school in western Bosnia, local media report

articles.author: Tom Bergin, Lawrence Delevingne, Koh Qing
articles.description: Golf is a bright spot at a precarious moment: the Trump Organization faces more than $530 million of court judgments and interest, a weak real-estate market, and the possibility of Trump losing his presidential run.
articles.title: Trump earns big from Florida golf resorts as his other businesses flag
